intro: Saurauia micayensis, commonly known as the Micay Mountain Saurauia, is a species of flowering plant in the Ericaceae family. It is native to the high-altitude regions of the Andes in Colombia, where it thrives in cool, moist environments. The plant is characterized by its small, evergreen leaves and clusters of white or pale pink flowers. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, often found in cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Saurauia micayensis is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
